channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2023080464
item.description:
Report X-2023080464

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP BY THE RESPONDER. IN THE DMP, PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN ONE, 1 GALLON, PLASTIC JUG OF NU-BRITE CONDENSER COIL CLEANER, BEING SHIPPED AS A CORROSIVE HAZ-MAT PACKAGE (UN3266, CORROSIVE LIQUID, BASIC, INORGANIC, N.O.S., (SODIUM HYDROXIDE), 8, II, 1 FIBERBOARD BOX X 1 GALLON). UPON INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED THE CAP ON THE GALLON JUG WAS LOOSE, WHICH ALLOWED A SMALL AMOUNT OF THE SODIUM HYDROXIDE SOLUTION TO LEAK ONTO THE OUTSIDE CARTON. ALL PRODUCT WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023081382
item.description:
Report X-2023081382

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AUDITOR NOTED THAT THE PACKAGE HAD A SMALL STAIN, AND NOTIFIED THE RESPONDER, WHO BROUGHT THE PACKAGE TO THE PROCESSING AREA. DURING INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED LEAKAGE CAME FROM LOOSE CAP ON INNNER CONTAINER. THE PACKAGE WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP USING THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET.

item.title: Report X-2023080770
item.description:
Report X-2023080770

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: manager discovered a damaged hazmat as it was being unloaded from a van on the 900 van line and called it out to QA. HESS specialist responded to the call and went to fetch it. HESS specialist placed it in a lined tote and brought it back to the damage area, where they placed it atop the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one bottle leaked a small amount due to loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023080757
item.description:
Report X-2023080757

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: STEWARTVILLE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was placed on the back end of a trailer with no packages to support it and keep it upright, this package could have been placed inside a fuller trailer with packages to support it and keep it from moving around and tipping over on its side. DescribePack: the package tipped over and the cap came off slightly which then caused liquid to leak out of the jug. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was removed from the trailer and placed upright and brought to the hazmat cage in the facility

item.title: Report E-2023080891
item.description:
Report E-2023080891

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: FARMINGTON
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 15, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1992 were punctured by a faulty skid and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EX Environmental (EX) to remediate the site. EX personnel unloaded the freight and deployed granular absorbents to the release. The crew then containerized all UN1992-impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023080871
item.description:
Report E-2023080871

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: FRIDLEY
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one 1500 pound large forklift battery(un2794) had fallen over and released 2 gallons of acid. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
